get.description: Retrieves past Adaptive Media Delivery activity data using parameters you specify. See [Sample Usage: Steps to get data](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/reference/sample-usage-steps-to-get-data) for an example of this operation.
get.summary: Get Adaptive Media Delivery historical data

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Media Delivery Reports API

200.description: OK. Empty rows are returned in the response body when there's no available data.

parameters.description: Specify the dimensions to use for the report, as comma-separated IDs. You need to include at least the `dimensions` or `metrics` parameter, but you can include both if desired. See the table of available AMD [dimensions](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/docs/rpt-dm-amd#the-dimensions) which includes their API-specific `id` values.
parameters.name: dimensions

parameters.description: Specify the metrics to use for the report, as comma-separated IDs. You need to include at least the `metrics` or `dimensions` parameter, but you can include both if desired. See the table of available AMD [metrics](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/docs/rpt-metrics-amd#the-metrics) which includes their API-specific `id` values.
parameters.name: metrics

parameters.description: Limit data to a specific set of comma-delimited [CP codes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/reference/get-started#get-your-cp-code). These CP codes pertain to the individual configurations set up, per product, to deliver media content. For example, when you set up a property in Property Manager to deliver content, you assign it a CP code.
parameters.name: cpcodes

parameters.description: The end date string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`, using the GMT (UTC) time zone.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: The start date string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`, using the GMT (UTC) time zone.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The number of rows to return from `1` to `10000`. `300` is the default.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The offset of the row from which reported data should start, used to request progressive batches of data.  For example, you can make 10 requests for 1000 records by setting the overall `limit` to `100`, then setting the `offset` to `0`, `100`, `200`, and so on for each request.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The time period to group each data record, in seconds. You can use either a specific number of seconds, or use the keyword values `day`, `week`, `month`, or `year`.  By default, reports for data ranging less than a day aggregate in five minute intervals. For up to 12 days, data aggregates hourly. For up to 30 days, data aggregates daily.
parameters.name: aggregation

parameters.description: A UTF-8 URL-encoded JSON object representing filter parameters that limit reported data.
parameters.name: filterParams

parameters.description: A UTF-8 URL-encoded JSON object representing sort parameters that rearrange the reported data. When no `sortParams` are specified, the response is sorted chronologically for time based queries, or otherwise on the first metric.
parameters.name: sortParams

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limits data to the type of traffic, `non-secure` for HTTP traffic, `secure-shared` for standard secure (HTTPS) traffic using the Akamai "shared certificate, `secure-standard` for Standard TLS HTTPS traffic, `secure-premium` for Enhanced TLS HTTPS traffic, or the default `all`. Older options are still supported including, `http` for non-secure traffic, `ssl` for secure shared-certificate traffic, and `essl` for secure customer-certificate traffic. However, it's best to use the newer options.
parameters.name: deliveryOption

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limit data to the context of media delivery, `live`, `vod` (video on demand), or the default `all`.
parameters.name: deliveryType

parameters.description: __Enum__ Report on `sp_hds` for stream packaging HDS, `sp_hls` for stream packaging HLS, `pt_hls` for HLS, `pt_hds` for HDS, `pt_dash` for DASH, `smooth` for Microsoft Smooth Streaming, `others`, or the default `all`.
parameters.name: deliveryFormat

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limit reported data to `encrypted` or `unencrypted` media, or specify the default `all` for unlimited data.
parameters.name: mediaEncryption

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limit reported data per IP version, `ipv4`, `ipv6`, or the default `all` for either version.
parameters.name: ipVersion

parameters.description: If set to `true`, the name you've set for each [CP code](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/reference/get-started#get-your-cp-code) is included along with its numeric identifier.
parameters.name: enableCPCodeName

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). schema.description: A data store is a collection of dimensions and metrics stored in a database.

aggregationInSeconds.description: Number of seconds for which data is aggregated.

dimensions.description: Encapsulates dimensions for the data store. A dimension acts like a key in data exploration and answers questions such as who, what, where, and which. Each dimension object provides information on the ID, name, type, and description of the dimension.

id.description: A unique identifier for each dimension.

type.description: The type of dimension, either `standard` or `custom`.

id.description: Unique identifier for each data store.

maxQueryDurationInMinutes.description: Maximum integer of minutes for which a user can query a data store. It's a system-imposed limit for better performance.

metrics.description: Encapsulates metrics for the data store. A metric is a numeric aggregation against one or more dimensions and answers questions on volume of activity or attack. Each metric object provides information on the name, description, and ID of the metric.

id.description: A unique identifier for each metric.

name.description: The name of the data store.

purgeIntervalInDays.description: Number of days for which the data store keeps data.

type.description: The type of data store, either `standard` or `custom`.

get.description: Retrieves past Download Delivery activity data using parameters you specify.
get.summary: Get Download Delivery historical data

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Media Delivery Reports API

200.description: OK. Empty rows are returned in the response body when there's no available data.

parameters.description: Specify the dimensions to use for the report, as comma-separated IDs. You need to include at least the `dimensions` or `metrics` parameter, but you can include both if desired. See the table of available Download Delivery [dimensions](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/docs/rpt-dm-dd#the-dimensions) which includes their API-specific `id` values.
parameters.name: dimensions

parameters.description: Specify the metrics to use for the report, as comma-separated IDs. You need to include at least the `metrics` or `dimensions` parameter, but you can include both if desired. See the table of available Download Delivery [metrics](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/docs/rpt-metrics-ace#the-metrics) which includes their API-specific `id` values.
parameters.name: metrics

parameters.description: Limit data to a specific set of comma-delimited [CP codes](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/reference/get-started#get-your-cp-code). These CP codes pertain to the individual configurations set up, per product, to deliver media content. For example, when you set up a property in Property Manager to deliver content, you assign it a CP code.
parameters.name: cpcodes

parameters.description: The end date string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`, using the GMT (UTC) time zone.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: The start date string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`, using the GMT (UTC) time zone.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The number of rows to return from `1` to `10000`. `300` is the default.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The offset of the row from which reported data should start, used to request progressive batches of data.  For example, you can make 10 requests for 1000 records by setting the overall `limit` to `100`, then setting the `offset` to `0`, `100`, `200`, and so on for each request.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The time period to group each data record, in seconds. You can use either a specific number of seconds, or use the keyword values `day`, `week`, `month`, or `year`.  By default, reports for data ranging less than a day aggregate in five minute intervals. For up to 12 days, data aggregates hourly. For up to 30 days, data aggregates daily.
parameters.name: aggregation

parameters.description: A UTF-8 URL-encoded JSON object representing filter parameters that limit reported data.
parameters.name: filterParams

parameters.description: A UTF-8 URL-encoded JSON object representing sort parameters that rearrange the reported data. When no `sortParams` are specified, the response is sorted chronologically for time based queries, or otherwise on the first metric.
parameters.name: sortParams

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limits data to the type of traffic, `non-secure` for HTTP traffic, `secure-shared` for standard secure (HTTPS) traffic using the Akamai "shared certificate, `secure-standard` for Standard TLS HTTPS traffic, `secure-premium` for Enhanced TLS HTTPS traffic, or the default `all`. Older options are still supported including, `http` for non-secure traffic, `ssl` for secure shared-certificate traffic, and `essl` for secure customer-certificate traffic. However, it's best to use the newer options.
parameters.name: deliveryOption

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limit reported data to `encrypted` or `unencrypted` media, or specify the default `all` for unlimited data.
parameters.name: mediaEncryption

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limit reported data per IP version, `ipv4`, `ipv6`, or the default `all` for either version.
parameters.name: ipVersion

parameters.description: If set to `true`, the name you've set for each [CP code](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/reference/get-started#get-your-cp-code) is included along with its numeric identifier.

For example, when you set up a property in Property Manager to deliver content, you assign it a CP code.
parameters.name: cpcodes

parameters.description: The end date string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`, using the GMT (UTC) time zone.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: The start date string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`, using the GMT (UTC) time zone.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The number of rows to return from `1` to `10000`. `300` is the default.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The offset of the row from which reported data should start, used to request progressive batches of data.  For example, you can make 10 requests for 1000 records by setting the overall `limit` to `100`, then setting the `offset` to `0`, `100`, `200`, and so on for each request.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The time period to group each data record, in seconds. You can use either a specific number of seconds, or use the keyword values `day`, `week`, `month`, or `year`.  By default, reports for data ranging less than a day aggregate in five minute intervals. For up to 12 days, data aggregates hourly. For up to 30 days, data aggregates daily.
parameters.name: aggregation

parameters.description: A UTF-8 URL-encoded JSON object representing filter parameters that limit reported data.
parameters.name: filterParams

parameters.description: A UTF-8 URL-encoded JSON object representing sort parameters that rearrange the reported data. When no `sortParams` are specified, the response is sorted chronologically for time based queries, or otherwise on the first metric.
parameters.name: sortParams

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limit data to the context of media delivery, `live`, `vod` (video on demand), or the default `all`.
parameters.name: deliveryType

parameters.description: If set to `true`, the name you've set for each [CP code](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-delivery-rpts/reference/get-started#get-your-cp-code) is included along with its numeric identifier.
